gurmukhi: ਪਰੀ ਮਾਰ ਮਾਰੰ ॥ ਮੰਡੇ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਧਾਰੰ ॥ ਰਟੈ ਮਾਰ ਮਾਰੰ ॥ ਤੁਟੈ ਖੱਗ ਧਾਰੰ ॥੪੨੬॥
transliteration: Parimaar Maaran|| Mande Sastra Dhaaran|| Ratai Maar Maaran|| Toutai Khagg Dhaaran||426||
translation: There were blows of arms and the edges of the weapons were sharpened; the warriors repeated the shouts of “kill, kill” and the edge of the spears began to break.426.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਠੈ ਛਿੱਛ ਅਪਾਰੰ ॥ ਬਹੈ ਸ੍ਰੋਣ ਧਾਰੰ ॥ ਹਸੈ ਮਾਸਹਾਰੰ ॥ ਪੀਅੈ ਸ੍ਰੋਣ ਸਯਾਰੰ ॥੪੨੭॥
transliteration: Outhai Chhichchh Apaaran|| Bahai Sron Dhaaran|| Hasai Maas-haaran|| Peeai Sron Syaaran||427||
translation: There was continuous flow of blood and it also spattered; the flesh-eaters smiled and the jackals drank blood.427.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰੇ ਚੳੁਰ ਚਾਰੰ ॥ ਭਜੇ ੲੇਕ ਹਾਰੰ ॥ ਰਟੈ ੲੇਕ ਮਾਰੰ ॥ ਗਿਰੇ ਸੂਰ ਸੁਅਾਰੰ ॥੪੨੮॥
transliteration: Gire Chaur Chaaran|| Bhaje Ek Haaran|| Ratai Ek Maaran|| Gire Soor Suaaran||428||
translation: The beautiful fly-whiskers fell and on one side the defeated warriors ran away; then were repetitions of the shouts of “Kill, Kill” on the other side and the horse-riders fell.428.

gurmukhi: ਚਲੇ ੲੇਕ ਸੁਅਾਰੰ ॥ ਪਰੇ ੲੇਕ ਬਾਰੰ ॥ ਬਡੋ ਜੁੱਧ ਪਾਰੰ ॥ ਨਿਕਾਰੇ ਹਥਯਾਰੰ ॥੪੨੯॥
transliteration: Chale Ek Suaaran|| Dare Ek Baaran|| Bado Juddh Paaran|| Nikdare Hathyaaran||429||
translation: On one side the horse-riders started moving and altogether made and attack. They drew out their weapons and began o wage a terrible war.429.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੈ ੲੇਕ ਵਾਰੰ ॥ ਲਸੈ ਖੱਗ ਧਾਰੰ ॥ ੳੁਠੈ ਅੰਗਿਅਾਰੰ ॥ ਲਖੈ ਬਯੋਮ ਚਾਰੰ ॥੪੩੦॥
transliteration: Darai Su Vaaran|| Lasai Khagg Dhaaran|| Outhai Aniaaran|| Lakhai Byom Chaaran||430||
translation: The striking sharp edges of the swords look impressive, the knocking on the shields and the collision of the swords create sparks, which are being seen by the gods from the sky.430.

gurmukhi: ਸੁ ਪੈਜੰ ਪਚਾਰੰ ॥ ਮੰਡੇ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਧਾਰੰ ॥ ਕਰੇਂ ਮਾਰ ਮਾਰੰ ॥ ੲਿਕੇ ਕੰਪ ਚਾਰੰ ॥੪੩੧॥
transliteration: Su Paijan Pachaaran|| Mande Astra Dhaaran|| Dared Maar Maaran|| Ike Kanp Chaaran||431||
translation: He, on whom the warriors attack, they thrust on him the sharp edges of their arms, the shout of “Kill, Kill” is being raised and the warriors trembling with rage look impressive.431.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾਂ ਬੀਰ ਜੁੱਟੈਂ ॥ ਸਰੰ ਸੰਜ ਫੁੱਟੈਂ ॥ ਤੜੰਕਾਰ ਛੁੱਟੈਂ ॥ ਝੜੰਕਾਰ ੳੁੱਠੈਂ ॥੪੩੨॥
transliteration: Mahaan Beer Jouttain|| Saran Sanj Phouttain|| Tadankaar Chouttain|| Jhadankaar Outthain||432||
translation: The great warriors have fought with one another and the armours are being torn by the arrows; the arrows are being discharged with crackling sound and the tinkling sound is being heard.432.

gurmukhi: ਸਰੰਧਾਰ ਬੁੱਠੈਂ ॥ ਜੁਗੰ ਜੁੱਧ ਜੁੱਠੈਂ ॥ ਰਣੰ ਰੋਸੁ ਰੁੱਠੈਂ ॥ ੲਿਕੰ ੲੇਕ ਕੁੱਠੈਂ ॥੪੩੩॥
transliteration: Sarandhaar Boutthain|| Jougadg Juddh Joutthain|| Ranan Ros(u) Routthain|| Ikan Ek Koutthain||433||
translation: There is shower of arrows and it appears that the whole world is absorbed in the war; the warriors are knocking their blows in fury over one another and are chopping (the limbs).433.

gurmukhi: ਢਲੀ ਢਾਲ ੳੁੱਠੈਂ ॥ ਅਰੰ ਫੳੁਜ ਫੁੱਟੈਂ ॥ ਕਿ ਨੇਜੇ ਪਲੱਟੈ ॥ ਚਮਤਕਾਰ ੳੁੱਠੈ ॥੪੩੪॥
transliteration: Dhalidhaal Outthain|| Aran Hauj Phouttain|| Ki Neje Palattai|| Chamatkaar Outthai||434||
translation: The fallen shields are being picked up and the forces of the enemy are being torn asunder; the lances are overturning and being used miraculously.434.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਤੇ ਭੂਮਿ ਲੁੱਠੈਂ ॥ ਗਿਰੇ ੲੇਕ ੳੁੱਠੈਂ ॥ ਰਣੰ ਫੇਰਿ ਜੁੱਟੈਂ ॥ ਬਹੇ ਤੇਗ ਤੁੱਟੈਂ ॥੪੩੫॥
transliteration: Kite Bhooman Loutthain|| Gire Ek Outthain|| Ranan Pher(i) Jouttain|| Bade Teg Touttain||435||
translation: Many people are lying down on the earth and many of those fallen down are getting up and being absorbed in the war, are excessively knocking and breaking their swords.435.

gurmukhi: ਮਚੇ ਵੀਰ ਵੀਰੰ ॥ ਧਰੇ ਵੀਰ ਚੀਰੰ ॥ ਕਰੈ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਪਾਤੰ ॥ ੳੁਠੈ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਘਾਤੰ ॥੪੩੬॥
transliteration: Mache Veer Vderan|| Ddare Veer Chderan|| Darai Sastra Paatan|| Outhai Astra Ghaatan||436||
translation: The warriors are fighting with warriors and are ripping them with their weapons; they are causing the weapons to fall down and inflicting wounds with their arms.436.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤੈਂ ਬਾਨ ਰਾਜੰ ॥ ੳੁਤੈ ਕੰਭ ਕਾਜੰ ॥ ਕਰਯੋ ਸਾਲ ਪਾਤੰ ॥ ਗਿਰਯੋ ਵੀਰ ਭ੍ਰਾਤੰ ॥੪੩੭॥
transliteration: Itain Baan Raajan|| Outai Kounbh Kaajan|| Daryo Saal Paatan|| Giryo Veer Bhraatan||437||
translation: On this side the arrows are being discharged and on that side Kumbhkaran is doing his job of destroying the army, but in the end that brother of Ravana fell down like the tree of saal.437.

gurmukhi: ਦੋੳੂ ਜਾਂਘ ਫੂਟੀ ॥ ਰਤੰ ਧਾਰ ਛੂਟੀ ॥ ਗਿਰੇ ਰਾਮ ਦੇਖੇ ॥ ਬਡੇ ਦੁਸਟ ਲੇਖੇ ॥੪੩੮॥
transliteration: Dooo Jaanh Phootee|| Ratan Dhaar Chootee|| Gire Raam Dekhe|| Bade Doust Lekhe||438||
